title: Colonial America and Early Settlement

vocab.definition: A settlement controlled by a distant country
A document giving permission to establish a colony
A colony owned and governed by an individual
A person who worked for a period to pay for passage to America
An economic system where colonies provide raw materials to the mother country

teachingNotes: Compare different types of colonies and their purposes. Discuss how geography influenced colonial development.

shortanswer.question: How did mercantilism benefit the mother country but limit colonial economic freedom?
expectedAny: Colonies provided raw materials that enriched the mother country while limiting colonial trade and manufacturing
The mother country gained wealth from colonial resources while restricting colonial economic independence
Mercantilism benefited the mother country through colonial raw materials but prevented colonies from trading freely

shortanswer.question: Why did geography lead to different colonial economies?
expectedAny: Different climates and resources led to different products and industries
Geography determined what crops could grow and what resources were available
Land and climate influenced whether colonies focused on farming, trade, or other activities

shortanswer.question: What advantages and disadvantages did indentured servants face?
expectedAny: They got passage to America but had to work for years before gaining freedom
Servants received transportation but faced years of hard labor
They could come to America but lost freedom for the contract period

shortanswer.question: How did a proprietary colony differ from a royal colony?
expectedAny: A proprietary colony was owned by an individual while a royal colony was controlled by the king
Proprietary colonies had private owners while royal colonies were governed directly by the crown
Individual owners controlled proprietary colonies but the king controlled royal colonies

shortanswer.question: Why did England want to establish colonies in America?
expectedAny: To gain resources and wealth through trade and raw materials
For economic benefits from colonial resources and markets
To expand trade and access natural resources for economic gain

shortanswer.question: What role did a charter play in colonial settlement?
expectedAny: It gave legal permission to establish a colony with certain rights
A charter provided official approval and defined colonial powers
It granted the legal right to settle and govern colonial territory

shortanswer.question: How did mercantilism shape colonial trade policies?
expectedAny: Policies were designed to benefit the mother country by restricting colonial trade
Trade rules forced colonies to send resources to England and buy English goods
Restrictions ensured colonial trade benefited the mother country economically

shortanswer.question: Why did many colonists seek religious freedom in America?
expectedAny: They faced persecution for their beliefs and wanted freedom to practice religion
To escape religious persecution and worship freely
They sought freedom to practice their religious beliefs without interference

shortanswer.question: What was the relationship between colonists and the mother country?
expectedAny: The mother country controlled and governed the distant colonies
Colonies were dependent on and controlled by the mother country
The distant mother country exercised control over colonial affairs

shortanswer.question: How did colonial settlements benefit England economically?
expectedAny: Colonies provided raw materials and markets that increased English wealth
England gained wealth through colonial raw materials and trade
Colonial resources and markets benefited English economic interests
